comments:
After starting up eclipse, the Package Explorer complained that it was "Unable
to create view: Argument not valid"

Closing the explorer view and re-showing it did not fix the problem.

Closing and restarting eclipse fixed the problem.

Stacktrace from Details>>:

Ken, do you remember which file you had active when Eclipse restarted. The
problem happened while linking the package explorer to the active editor.
Knowing the file type would help to track down the problem since I can't
reproduce it.

This is a dup of 85881, however since it happened the third time now we should
really track this down.

Ken, any additional steps you can think of ?

I believe the only files I had open were java files.

My previous eclipse session was shut down automatically by Windows XP.  (Windows
had automatically restarted after running windows update.)  Maybe eclipse was
shut down uncleanly during that restart?
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 85881 ***
